document.title: New Jersey Core Curriculum Content Standards for Visual and Performing Arts

E65BBC7614B241D1B3A9148EE9E890B3.description: Recognize the making subject or theme in works of dance, music, theatre, and visual art.

142D6B8069D74AC4A7242FFFB27162CE.description: Contextual clues are embedded in works of art and provide insight into artistic intent.

B6467FC7981D446BB5BB28C7A07A8B24.description: Apply the principles of positive critique in giving and receiving responses to performances.

93BEB21DE723420AADBDE2CA129F6C8E.description: Constructive criticism is an important evaluative tool that enables artists to communicate more effectively.

6EFE0BCBED464A718127139F80C6307D.description: Observe the basic arts elements in performances and exhibitions and use them to formulate objective assessments of artworks in dance, music, theatre, and visual art.

887F6E0C388444CF9A9840403413B678.description: Relative merits of works of art can be qualitatively and quantitatively assessed using observable criteria.

885DE35DA6ED454293B96FECFD20D133.description: Distinguish patterns in nature found in works of dance, music, theatre, and visual art.

8695EB3B526F495CBAD24E880AA1A8EC.description: Use imagination to create a story based on an arts experience that communicated an emotion or feeling, and tell the story through each of the four arts disciplines (dance, music, theatre, and visual art).

768FB08B042940238A3414A98C18CE83.description: Compare and contrast culturally and historically diverse works of dance, music, theatre, and visual art that evoke emotion and that communicate cultural meaning.

DE119B0B72C14D77AAE27CF433BE031D.description: Identify aesthetic qualities of exemplary works of art in dance, music, theatre, and visual art, and identify characteristics of the artists who created them (e.g., gender, age, absence or presence of training, style, etc.).

EDF66AEC2F7D4D87AFE014B46365AEFD.description: Each arts discipline (dance, music, theatre, and visual art) has distinct characteristics, as do the artists who create them.

276C98F2598E4C5580230F5D26ED7571.description: Aesthetic Responses & Critique Methodologies: All students will demonstrate and apply an understanding of arts philosophies, judgment, and analysis to works of art in dance, music, theatre, and visual art.

96C7CE3878934F889E9A5C4FFED4329E.description: Create works of art that are based on observations of the physical world and that illustrate how art is part of everyday life, using a variety of art mediums and art media.

D3951339AB4C4A8087339EA28DDB97D3.description: Visual awareness stems from acute observational skills and interest in visual objects, spaces, and the relationship of objects to the world.

0A361D52B43F439793C26B920C349F6B.description: Explore the use of a wide array of art mediums and select tools that are appropriate to the production of works of art in a variety of art media.

9EA1B59C3782460194FE2386522AFAAE.description: Knowledge of visual art media necessitates an understanding of a variety of traditional and nontraditional tools, applications, possibilities, and limitations.

2DD6DD87E8B64B92BEA1B74CA7C5FDB7.description: Employ basic verbal and visual art vocabulary to demonstrate knowledge of the materials, tools, and methodologies used to create and tell visual stories.

4B0157C59B4E43D2B50C65BFFCA28513.description: Each of the visual art forms uses various materials, tools, and techniques that are associated with unique verbal and visual vocabularies.

3570F6AA716440F299614CA4C001BBA2.description: Use symbols to create personal works of art based on selected age-appropriate themes, using oral stories as a basis for pictorial representation.

56944492A33343B1BB244A98DBD87DFC.description: Symbols convey meaning agreed upon by a group or culture. Manipulation of the basic elements of art and principles of design for personal expression results in visual communication that may be relevant in a variety of settings.

8824E9722A32480AA0BE385B0273D7BD.description: Create two- and three-dimensional works of art using the basic elements of color, line, shape, form, texture, and space, as well as a variety of art mediums and application methods.

A9C7FB5E09D74BD98AAB7F9D155CC130.description: Visual statements in art are derived from the basic elements of art regardless of the format and medium used to create the art. There are also a wide variety of art media, each having its own materials, processes, and technical application methods for exploring solutions to creative problems.

387B959CD7374834AE743BD884A0201E.description: Develop awareness of vocal range, personal space, and character-specific vocal and creative movement choices.

19E3EB1C5FB84129979E42629363FFCC.description: Voice and movement have broad ranges of expressive potential.

3864DD98295140D6B4FC77255E652473.description: Use voice and movement in solo, paired, and group pantomimes and improvisations.

B23197821D28402CB7BDF4C68F19C3A5.description: Actors use voice and movement as tools for storytelling.

37A66C5898274BC882C350E214C75E83.description: Portray characters when given specifics about circumstances, plot, and thematic intent, demonstrating logical story sequence and informed character choices.

C7CD558832814B2F87E771C5E93FB458.description: Plays may use narrative structures to communicate themes.

6BB6184A2BDB42AD8A7CF48C4BFEC67D.description: Blend unison and harmonic parts and vocal or instrumental timbres while matching dynamic levels in response to a conductor's cues.

8F6517B0380747869B2DE6ED24569684.description: Basic conducting patterns and gestures provide cues about how and when to execute changes in dynamics, timbre, and timing.

55945478644B4537A2A9C41A85F3E603.description: Sing or play simple melodies or rhythmic accompaniments in AB and ABA forms independently and in groups, and sight-read rhythmic and music notation up to and including eighth notes and rests in a major scale.

81EDD6AD3E2545BDA7520232D2BD393C.description: Prescribed forms and rules govern music composition, rhythmic accompaniment, and the harmonizing of parts.

06A85B4664014DC8A78007D24D5C6E9D.description: Improvise short tonal and rhythmic patterns over ostinatos, and modify melodic or rhythmic patterns using selected notes and/or scales to create expressive ideas.

E33B548F317A478AA5F51EDD4780E1E9.description: Improvisation is a foundational skill for music composition.

BCF6E50BA978493AA39520808DE8C99D.description: Vocalize the home tone of familiar and unfamiliar songs, and demonstrate appropriate posture and breathing technique while performing songs, rounds, or canons in unison and with a partner.

39AF44595C034BFD968CFAAB3919CCC2.description: Proper breathing technique and correct posture improve the timbre of the voice and protect the voice when singing.

64B16AAF22C042B1A35841842C638C7E.description: Demonstrate correct playing techniques for Orff instruments or equivalent homemade instruments.

D038E9EE2EC743BEB14CE36101EB19AC.description: Playing techniques for Orff instruments develop foundational skills used for hand percussion and melodic percussion instruments.

4016C293F2244C479EFDA0DE68734CA2.description: Demonstrate developmentally appropriate vocal production/vocal placement and breathing technique.

F66AE556E6FC44F3853F680BB1A4B4C3.description: Proper vocal production/vocal placement requires an understanding of basic anatomy and the physical properties of sound.

ED61D5205DE0483BB520EC8D89D25CA7.description: Clap, sing, or play on pitch from basic notation in the treble clef, with consideration of pitch, rhythm, dynamics, and tempo.

411EC4120B4648968A513DD47189EC4E.description: The ability to read music notation correlates with musical fluency and literacy. Notation systems are complex symbolic languages that indicate pitch, rhythm, dynamics, and tempo.

880A9256782345A580B1EA2DE6976124.description: Create and perform original movement sequences alone and with a partner using locomotor and non-locomotor movements at various levels in space.

423AD55DAE9E4338BD252E3D0F870BAA.description: Locomotor and non-locomotor movements may contribute equally to the thematic content of solo and ensemble dances.

E8A525A4295040ABBA7F45D6B31D0F73.description: Define and maintain personal space, concentrate, and appropriately direct focus while performing movement skills.

F30D3AB1B8ED4909B123495E8EA93BC2.description: The integrity of choreographed sequences is maintained by personal and group spatial relationships. Dance movement skills also require concentration and the intentional direction of focus during performance.

13A7E5F4E4FC41949D4EB1255AF7AB9E.description: Create and perform planned and improvised movement sequences, alone and in small groups, with variations in tempo, meter, rhythm, spatial level (i.e., low, middle, and high), and spatial pathway.

127B5C24C2624F0498E9157F7BE10EEF.description: The creation of an original dance composition often begins with improvisation. Movement sequences change when applying the elements of dance.

D819CE68EE9741C69B940D2F3E95A1A7.description: Create and perform planned and improvised movement sequences using the elements of dance, with and without musical accompaniment, to communicate meaning around a variety of themes.

9DE280875DD64CB7A270E0E394F4E8E6.description: The elements of dance are time, space, and energy. Improvisational structures facilitate movement invention. Musical or non-musical accompaniment is a choice. Dance can communicate meaning around a variety of themes.

E1E6CCBC317E4AC89B6CCA9C784690C4.description: Performance: All students will synthesize those skills, media, methods, and technologies appropriate to creating, performing, and/or presenting works of art in dance, music, theatre, and visual art.

5B283502A9624BD3A7D2C02241F95FB5.description: Identify how artists and specific works of dance, music, theatre, and visual art reflect, and are affected by, past and present cultures.

0A2F0B3F60BA4857872971D4299098DF.description: The function and purpose of art-making across cultures is a reflection of societal values and beliefs.

888BAC0C7ED741858462BD9C78D7E7BC.description: Identify characteristic theme-based works of dance, music, theatre, and visual art, such as artworks based on the themes of family and community, from various historical periods and world cultures.

E73857BEB45A43BCBE8227065F6B14F8.description: Dance, music, theatre, and visual artwork from diverse cultures and historical eras have distinct characteristics and common themes that are revealed by contextual clues within the works of art.

1A246E6B7BBF4C69A9BCB66F2041D2BD.description: History of the Arts and Culture

7C6087F7177044A0A39BE805EAB523D2.description: History of the Arts and Culture: All students will understand the role, development, and influence of the arts throughout history and across cultures.

577F36178CE340AD84ADB39C5D65B512.description: Identify elements of art and principles of design in specific works of art and explain how they are used.

75F7C171F4F74C0AB3F2932A3279C2CE.description: Recognizing the elements of art and principles of design in artworks of known and emerging artists, as well as peers, is an initial step toward visual literacy.

3399BB3CE9184369B9E3A03E8276FA74.description: Identify the basic elements of art and principles of design in diverse types of artwork.

8A440C484EDE4A7A938C8621C563B413.description: The basic elements of art and principles of design govern art creation and composition.

F389B30D23E243048D31D8EE755075B2.description: Describe the use of the technical theatrical elements by examining examples of theatrical design in productions.

14408D1115A144D5BD98CB14300689F7.description: The technical theatrical elements and theatre architecture are inherent in theatrical design and production.

EF8DBBC2FB614C7BAC6ECE5E57B44C5D.description: Distinguish between characters, actors, and the self by demonstrating respect for personal space, creative movement, and pantomime skills while interacting with others in creative drama and storytelling.

93AD0A1AE7064BFC93F2200AE499D72F.description: Creative drama and storytelling use voice, movement, and facial expression to communicate emotions. Creating characters is an act of intention in which actors play themselves in an imaginary set of circumstances.

FA183830971A4BFA90F89A3D38839A41.description: Express stage directions, areas of the stage, basic stage movements, and parts of a script using correct theatre terms (e.g., setting, costumes, plot, theme, etc.).

B634DA946B0849A887108C2132C46DE5.description: Theatre artists use precise vocabulary when staging a play.

CB6FBB6BBA1343C69F818BA316BCC579.description: Identify basic elements of theatre and describe their use in a variety of theatrical performances.

2AD0F9AA9FB449A7A5FF0B81417067D0.description: The elements of theatre are recognizable in theatrical performances.

54C1B5B65886432DBC2257F12E83BA37.description: Categorize families of instruments and identify their associated musical properties.

0D85470E5A6A46BCAD546EB52F180076.description: Musical instruments have unique qualities of tonality and resonance. Conventional instruments are divided into musical families according to shared properties.

E95B831E84384BEF87244232007CE3AA.description: Identify and categorize sound sources by common traits (e.g., scales, rhythmic patterns, and/or other musical elements), and identify rhythmic notation up to eighth notes and rests.

622FC6DDCF9646519E7E9A1B2143F337.description: Music is often defined as organized sound that is dependent on predictable properties of tone and pitch. Musical notation captures tonality, dynamic range, and rhythm.

05BD0BF71D2B4BD096DE2F17A9B4B999.description: Identify musical elements in response to diverse aural prompts, such as rhythm, timbre, dynamics, form, and melody.

A074089995FE4F189E1B334C181B5127.description: The elements of music are foundational to basic music literacy.

F96BF344D3B14478B65235D86B9993FF.description: Explore the elements of music through verbal and written responses to diverse aural prompts and printed scores.

EEB679FED5A745038BBB0D61E06CEBC8.description: Ear training and listening skill are prerequisites for musical literacy.

0AEA5D9303C940A6837056F5B3189819.description: Apply and adapt isolated and coordinated body part articulations, body alignment, balance, and body patterning.

07D0BDEC971B470D8AD73D4DC69050F0.description: The coordination and isolation of different body parts is dependent on the dynamic alignment of the body while standing and moving.

EFB4FE539924434097246536CB43E63F.description: Demonstrate the difference between pantomime, pedestrian movement, abstract gesture, and dance movement.

E02F5D74FDF04F06B88092DF069A5FD9.description: There are distinct differences between pedestrian movements and formal training in dance.

D00B8BF808404C26B99FC9D2B33D95EC.description: Use improvisation to discover new movement to fulfill the intent of the choreography.

F3F9C65723854D6A996A0CED71186063.description: Original movement is generated through improvisational skills and techniques.

97C5F0BD08494D9EA6F942947ECB9675.description: Identify the elements of dance in planned and improvised dance sequences.

8007F43C90F14EA89217499577D237BF.description: Original choreography and improvisation of movement sequences begins with basic understanding of the elements of dance.

14E3801E465042F1A4043DF4E853E700.description: The Creative Process: All students will demonstrate an understanding of the elements and principles that govern the creation of works of art in dance, music, theatre, and visual art.
